snippet: The construction of a public square in a deeply conservative Palestinian refugee camp has made some there feel more at home, a provocative concept in camps conceived as temporary.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook describes profound debates that have been inspired by construction of public square in Al Fawwar, West Bank, old and deeply conservative Palestinian refugee camp; notes that public space is mostly unheard-of in Palestinian camps across the West Bank.
lead_paragraph: The construction of a public square in a deeply conservative Palestinian refugee camp has made some there feel more at home, a provocative concept in camps conceived as temporary.

headline.main: Refugees Reshape Their Camp, at the Risk of Feeling at Home
headline.print_headline: Refugees Reshape Their Camp, at the Risk of Feeling at Home

keywords.value: United Nations Relief and Works Agency
keywords.name: organizations
